oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Interview - Ray Martin and Lance LeRoy - 2005-10-25
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview with Ray Martin and Lance LeRoy from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on May 25, 2005. Interview conducted by Eddie Stubbs following screening of the documentary film King of Bluegrass: The Life and Times of Jimmy Martin
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Eddie Stubbs; Ray Martin; Lance LeRoy;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Recording begins in progress. Opening comments from Jay Orr. Discussion and interview moderated by Eddie Stubbs. Includes questions from the audience. Subject includes; Jimmy Martin -- his live performances -- his recordings -- Reminiscences by Lance LeRoy -- Appearances on the Grand Ole Opry -- Bluegrass music's acceptance as a part of country music -- Jimmy Martin's personality and drive -- His wife and her influence -- Mass mailings of 45 rpm records -- Stories about the song Widow Maker -- Jimmy's time in Shreveport, Louisiana -- Coming to Nashville -- WWVA Wheeling Jamboree -- Story about Hank Williams, Bill Monroe and Jimmy Martin appearance together -- Lance LeRoy representing Jimmy Martin as an agent -- His drinking -- His passions -- How he wanted to be remembered -- Two sides to Jimmy -- Questions from the audience -- Jimmy's kindhearted side -- Giving food to Loretta Lynn -- Saving a child's life in automobile accident -- Helping Lance's family set up Christmas tree in his absence -- taking up money for needy family -- His being one of the first to hire girls to be in his group -- Gloria Belle introduction and story about Japanese tour airplane trip.
